name: Voga Exclusive Guesthouse

reviews.title: A very warm welcome to Chile
reviews.text: Our first stop in Chile was this great place. Right from the outset of booking months in advance, Gonzalo was very attentive to all my emails. He also arranged transport from Santiago airport with Miguel from Greeno Travel, also very attentive to our needs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, located on Cerro Alegre and within easy walk of everything, looks not too similar from other buildings in Valparaiso, although in better state of repair. It's like a tardis on the inside though. Clearly the building has taken influences from the Victorian era, with very high ceilings, a huge wooden staircase and big wooden doors. Gonzalo and his wife have kept in keeping with the history of the building with very tastefully designed large rooms, with a touch of modernity with a definite German influence. There is a huge downstairs sitting room for guests, a lovely breakfast room and a garden area with sun deck. Upstairs, and just outside our very comfortable room, which had a sea view, there was a modern designed seating area.
reviews.title: Charming homestay in fabulous city

reviews.text: Our room was large, had a very comfortable bed and a bathroom with shower and thick towels. Everything was of good quality here. The room also had a TV and free wifi.
reviews.title: Traditional chic hospitality offered by generous enthusiastic hosts and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were huge, very fresh and tasty and certainly set you up for the day. There were cereals, bread, cake, juice, salad, cheese, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit salad and yoghurt as well as a selection of teas and coffee. We are vegetarian and I believe there is meat if you're a meat eater.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!
Little gem in Valparaiso
reviews.text: Finally, Gonzalo, his wife, Ana, and Michelle were really lovely people who made our stay really enjoyable. There were plenty of recommendations, including literature - thanks Gonzalo, I downloaded Francisco Coloane, tours, restaurants and printing our boarding passes as well as helping arrange our transfer back to the airport with Miguel.

description: Voga is a restauration project that rescues an old Victorian house dates 1880. All original details that were reamaining in the house were restaured: wooden floors, parquett, doors and locos, even some lamps, etc. Following Chic&Basic concept the decoration is a mix between old and modern, that values good design and a feelling of home.Situated on 3 levels, Voga offers 6 rooms, all of them have modern private bathroom, most of the rooms have view to the Ocean.Features a common garden with fruit trees and a terrace with view.Located in the heart of Cerro Alegre, one of the most turistic hills of Valparaiso, Voga is a 5-minute walk from Baburizza Museum of Fine Arts, 15-minute walk from Anibal Pinto, next to main restaurants and sightseeings.Breakfast is served daily. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms.
